channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel says it received remains of 3 hostages from Gaza as fragile ceasefire holds
item.description: Israel says the remains of three hostages have been handed over from Gaza and will be examined by forensic experts as a month-old ceasefire holds.

item.title: In Chicago, a Halloween weekend of immigration arrests and violence
item.description: Over the weekend there were violent clashes between federal agents, witnesses and protesters. Locals say the festivities were muted this year, and fea...

item.title: I built this 'AI aunt' for women after family tragedy in South Africa
item.description: An AI chatbot and app for victims of abuse to get help is being piloted in South Africa.

item.title: Uncertainty over federal food aid rises as shutdown fight continues
item.description: Rulings by two federal judges eased pressure on SNAP benefits, although President Trump said payments are likely to be delayed.

item.title: Hamas hands over three coffins it says contain bodies of Gaza hostages
item.description: The remains will undergo formal identification in Israel, as the return of deceased hostages under a ceasefire continues.

item.title: At least eight dead after magnitude-6.3 earthquake hits Afghanistan
item.description: The quake struck near Mazar-e Sharif, one of Afghanistan's largest cities, in the early hours of Monday.

item.title: President Donald Trump's extended 60 Minutes interview
item.description: Norah O'Donnell sat down with President Donald J. Trump at Mar-a-Lago to discuss U.S.-China relations, Venezuela, Israel, the government shutdown, imm...

item.title: 10/29: The Daily Report
item.description: Lindsey Reiser reports on the damage left behind in Jamaica after Hurricane Melissa, and what to expect when President Trump meets with President Xi.

item.title: World awaits landmark US Supreme Court decision on Trump's tariffs
item.description: The top US court will decide if many of Trump's tariffs are legal in a case with major implications for presidential power and billions of dollars.

item.title: 11/2: CBS Weekend News
item.description: Government shutdown in crucial week as it approaches record length; Looking back on 25 years of the International Space Station

item.title: Trump says he doubts US will go to war with Venezuela
item.description: The US president plays down the possibility of war, but does not rule out land strikes.

item.title: President Trump's extended 60 Minutes interview
item.description: President Trump sat down with Norah O'Donnell to discuss U.S.-China relations, Venezuela, Israel, the government shutdown, immigration, the National G...

item.title: Kenyan runners win men's and women's races in New York City Marathon
item.description: Kipruto, an Olympic bronze medalist, narrowly beat fellow Kenyan Alexander Mutiso in the Pro Men's race, as both men finished with a time of 2:08:09.

item.title: Fire and explosion at northwestern Mexico store leave at least 23 dead and 12 injured
item.description: A fire and explosion at a convenience store in northwestern Mexico killed at least 23 people, including children, and injured 12 others, state authori...

item.title: How this week's elections in Virginia became about ... everything
item.description: Earlier this year, "quiet" was one word to describe the Virginia race for governor. Then came DOGE, a text message scandal down ballot, a redistrictin...

item.title: Uncertainty over federal food aid grows as the shutdown fight reaches a crisis point
item.description: The twin crises at the heart of the government shutdown fight in Washington are coming to a head. The federal food assistance program is facing delays...

item.title: SNAP benefits cut off during shutdown, driving long lines at food pantries
Ohio panel and Virginia lawmakers move forward with congressional redistricting plans
